responses.content:

Premise: If I take medication, I will feel better.
Conclusion: If I take medication that expired, I will feel better.

The argument is an example of a hypothetical syllogism with the form "If P, then Q; if R, then P; therefore, if R, then Q."

In this case, the argument does not follow the correct logical structure because it assumes that taking expired medication will have the same effect as taking non-expired medication. This is not necessarily true and depends on various factors such as the type of medication and how long it has been expired.

Step 4: Conclude whether the argument is logically valid or invalid.
The argument is logically invalid because it makes an unwarranted assumption about the effects of taking expired medication.
